article.title: A cavity-induced artificial gauge field in a Bose-Hubbard ladder

multiple_choice_question.text: What physical phenomenon does the cavity-induced tunneling in this setup simulate for the bosonic atoms?
choices: Spin-orbit coupling
Artificial gravity
Artificial magnetic field
Quantum entanglement

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the role of the potential offset (Δ) between the two wells in the x-direction?
choices: It suppresses tunneling along the rungs, necessitating the Raman-assisted hopping process.
It enhances the on-site interaction (U) between the atoms.
It creates a confining potential along the legs of the ladder.
It controls the phase (φ) accumulated by the atoms during tunneling.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the purpose of the two Raman transitions, each involving a cavity mode and a pump laser beam?
choices: To cool the atoms to ultracold temperatures.
To create a standing wave pattern for the cavity field.
To induce a spatially dependent phase imprint on the atoms during tunneling, simulating a magnetic field.
To measure the population of atoms in different energy levels.

multiple_choice_question.text: What type of atoms are considered in this study?
choices: Fermionic atoms
Bosonic atoms
Both fermionic and bosonic atoms
The type of atom is not specified in the figure.
The steady-state expectation value of the cavity field (a).
The energy difference between the two lowest energy levels of the system.
The effective tunneling amplitude (J₁) for the atoms.
The decay rate (κ) of the cavity photons.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the parameter  Ω represent?
choices: The detuning between the cavity mode and the pump beam.
The effective Rabi frequency of the Raman transitions.
The strength of the on-site interaction (U) between the atoms.
The wavelength of the pump laser beam.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the significance of the term (K₁ + K₁) in this formula?
choices: It represents the total number of atoms in the system.
It represents the expectation value of the directed rung tunneling operator.
It represents the decay rate of the atoms from excited states.
It represents the energy difference between the ground and excited states of the atoms.

multiple_choice_question.text: What condition needs to be met for a non-trivial solution (a ≠ 0) of this equation?
choices: δcp < 0
δcp > 0
(K₁ + K₁) = 0
